text: Zaporizhzhia Oblast () is an oblast (province) of southern Ukraine. The administrative centre is Zaporizhzhia. The population of Zaporizhzhia Oblast was 1,774,000 in 2014. Parts of the oblast (province), are occupied by Russian soldiers (as of 2024). The Zaporizhzhia Front is a front line. It is part of the Southern Front. Some of the settlements near the front (or on the front), are *Marfopil, on the side controlled by Russia (as of 2024's first quarter) *Huliaipole, on the side controlled by Ukraine (as of 2024's first quarter) *Verbove, on the side controlled by Russia (as of 2024's first quarter) *Robotyne, on the side controlled by Ukraine (as of 2024's first quarter) *Nesterianka, on the side controlled by Russia (as of 2024's first quarter) *Piatykhatky, on the side controlled by Ukraine (as of 2024's first quarter) ==Cities== The cities and the number of people (as of 2006): {| class="wikitable
